column2: ILLINOIS DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This yellow sign means:
2. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 3. Regardless of fault, a crash report must be filed by the driver of a vehicle if the crash involves property damage of more than $500.
4. Green signs:
column4: tell you about services along the roadway.
column6: tell you where you are, which way to go and the distance.
column8: alert you to possible dangers ahead due to unplanned traffic incidents.

column2: 5. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 6. When passing a bicyclist who is riding on the road, you must keep a minimum of ______ between your vehicle and the bicyclist or pedestrian.
7. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 8. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 9. Your driver’s license may be revoked for:
column8: Failure to yield to an emergency vehicle using audible and visual signals.

column2: 10. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
11. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
12. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 13. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 14. It is permissible to pass on a two-lane, two-way roadway within 100 feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.
15. When following a motorcycle, drivers do not need to allow as much distance as when following a car.
16. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 18. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 19. Signs providing directional and mileage information to specific destinations are:
20. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
21. If the front right wheel of a vehicle runs off the pavement, the driver should slow down by easing off the accelerator, then gently steer back onto the pavement.
22. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
26. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in school zones (on school days between 7 a.m. and 4 p.m. when children are present and signs are posted) is:
27. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Drive no less than 40 MPH around the curve ahead
column6: The speed limit after the curve ahead is 40 MPH.
column8: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less.

column2: 29. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 30. Black and white signs are regulatory signs.
31. Drivers must yield the right of way to a bicyclist just as they would to another vehicle.
32. This sign means:
33. A chemical test is used to measure:
34. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 35. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
